benchmark_details.name: ONEBench (OpeN-Ended Benchmarking)
benchmark_details.overview: ONEBench is a new paradigm that consolidates individual evaluation datasets into a unified, ever-expanding sample pool. It enables custom benchmarks for specific capabilities while reusing and aggregating samples, mitigating overfitting and dataset bias for broader capability assessment.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate models using a continuously expanding pool of test data samples drawn from multiple benchmarks and to provide a democratized, customizable evaluation framework.

data.source: Data sourced from multiple evaluation datasets including HELM, LMMs-Eval, and open source contributions.

methodology.calculation: Rankings are obtained through Plackett-Luce model aggregation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher rankings indicate better model performance on retrieval tasks.
methodology.validation: Empirical validation shows high correlation with ground-truth rankings.
